alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 11:37PM CDT until April 21 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BARRY COUNTY... At 1136 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Washburn, or 8 miles southwest of Cassville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Roaring River State Park... Cassville... Seligman... Exeter... Washburn... Eagle Rock... Wayne... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
